reviewTimeLines.summary: FAB-2717: A01-F11 AC4,5,6,11 - Leave Plan Electives Modifications

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment:
Because this entity now has a new entity associated to it, it will need to be created whenever PaidLeaveManagementService is created and it will also need to be cleared whenever the service is deactivated.
Take a look at "ServiceProvidedHelper.java" to see how this is being handled for "AbsenceManagementService"
This helper is the one responsible for creating and clearing the services. The "PaidLeaveManagementService" will now need to have a PaidLeaveManagementServiceOperations (similar to AbsenceManagementService) that will have the responsibility of creating the service and clearing all the data associated to it.
The @Aggregation annotation is not enough because the parent entity will never get deleted.
Testing for activation and deactivation of this service needs to be conducted with filled data in order to check if the data under the service is being cleared when the service is deactivated.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: This change is implmented by Ramana now and will be closed once he complete the changes.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: Code checked-in

This new field needs to be added to the "resetAttributes" method.
Otherwise when the service gets deactivated and activated again the old selected will not be cleared.

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment:
This associated should exist on the LeavePlan.
The parent of this entity is the Leave Plan, it doesn't mean anything without it.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: We discussed this with Gareth and he confirmed it to assocaite PaidLeavePlanPaymentServiceLevel with LeavePlanPaidLeave. I will forward the mail I had sent to him with the details if you like.

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment:
This annotation does nothing since this entity will never be deleted.
This list needs to be cleared manually.
Test with the activation and deactivation of a PaidLeaveManagementService.

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment: This method should not exist. A PaidLeaveManagementService should only be set on the PaidLeavePlanPaymentServiceLevel.

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment:
Will we have multiple service levels to the same paid leave management service? And can one leave plan be associated to more than one service level in the same paid management service?
If so, how can we decide which Administrative Service to apply to a leave plan when making a payment?

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
You are in the context of a Paid Leave Plan. Navigato LeavePlan -> LeavePlanPaidLeave -> find the associated PaidLeavePlanPaymentServiceLevel and then the PaymentServiceLevel on it. Note: In the context of a PaidLeaveManagementService context, there is only ONE-TO-ONE rel between PaidLeavePlanPaymentServiceLevel and LeavePlanPaidLeave. But in the DB context you can have a MANY-TO-ONE between them.
We can talk about this if you want.

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment: This should be linked to a LeavePlan

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
As above.
We discussed this with Gareth and he confirmed it to assocaite PaidLeavePlanPaymentServiceLevel with LeavePlanPaidLeave. I will forward the mail I had sent to him with the details if you like.

"class com.fineos.absence.serviceagreement.servicesprovided.PaidLeaveManagementStatutoryPaidLeavesWidget" is being returned as the class for this field in EntityFieldHelper.getClassInformation() method, on following line:
Class<?> classType = WebHelper.getParentClassType(valueExpression, pageContext, request, Object.class, container);

comments.author: Sachin Jaybhay
comments.comment: This is removed since we cannot have more that one Aggregation on Entity. But the aggregation is taken care indirectly. When OCCaseForServiceAgreement the ServiceDetails rel is deleted along with all the list of ServiceDetailsServiceProvided(which includes AbsenceManagementService and PaidLeaveManagementService). So whenever AbsenceManagementService deleted, PaidLeaveManagementService is deleted as well.

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment:
Naming standards.
We normally have an add..() method that calls an enter..() method and then clicks ok
The enter...() method fills in the fields on the page and doesn't have to be private in case it's used directly, for example, error checking

comments.author: Hugo Dias
comments.comment:
It's very bad to create an ArrayList populated and then remove one element.
If "Please Select" is always the first index, you can populate the list with getInstances().subList(fromIndex, toIndex).
Other option is using the LinkedList because the cost of removal is constant, mainly if it's the first element.

comments.comment: The suggested change has been incorporated

comments.author: Hugo Dias
comments.comment: Ensure also that Please Select is not in the list. The list could be reduced of 1 element and Please Select was still there.

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment:
We aren't creating packages for each feature - Epics maybe.
Test name isn't quite right - it implies there will be just one test - perhaps the class should be called PaidLeaveManagement and then the various test live within.
Is paid leave management still part of services provided ? If so there is a ServicesProvided test class

comments.author: Mohan Pattabhiramaswamy
comments.comment: We have taken this out of the package. The class name has been changed to EmployerPaidLeaveManagementTab after discussion with Odyssey team. We have 2 tabs with same name called Paid Leave Management under Service Agreement -> Absence and also in Leave Plan Management -> Edit Mode When the leave plan is of 'Paid' type. So to avoid confusion we have changed the class name. Regarding the ServicesProvided test class, We have multiple sections comming under SA-> Absence -> tabs. Each of the tabs under Absence have seperate test classes where all the test cases for that particular tab go in. So we have followed the similar convention and not putting the tests under ServicesProvided test class

comments.comment: missing description ( all tests \! )

comments.comment: We don't normally right tests just to verify a tab gets displayed. Presumable a number of future tests will be clicking the tab anyway, so if there are any issues thy'll be caught then

comments.comment: The test case has been removed

Mohan Pattabhiramaswamy

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
Even look at the packaging:
BO is in com.fineos.absence.serviceagreement.servicesdefinition.paidleaveplanelectives while the enum is in com.fineos.absence.entitlement.availability.enums
They seem completely unrelated....

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: Yes, This is discussed and it was said to re-use the one already existing in Absence.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
Yes, I agree, but in that case we have two options: 1. Create a separate new Enum. (Mostly not prefered one as above.) 2. Code refactor the Enum to a common place, and use it in both the place. We already have favourd this (refactoring remaining) than creating a new one. However this is/will create dependency between 2 or more differnt business contexts.
Need your support to know how such things are handled in Fineos. This seems to be a common thing happening - Reuse of enums defined some where for something else.

I've just refactored the method for calling the intake steps - captureAbsenceIntakeDetails() - it now lives on the page object.
